Topic.Title: Why is the market up today? We just got attacked in Boston...Over 120 Americans injured or dead

Message.Msg: Not to be cold, but why should the market go down because a bomb went off yesterday? There's not much of a connection. People are still buying coca cola and big macs.

Topic.Title: miss on revenue and beat earnings = accounting fraud

Message.Msg: Was there significant margin expansion? If they expanded margins enough they could pull that off. If margins were flat to down, something could be amiss. Today's pop had to be part of people looking to buy things are not levered to China, but spread out among global consumers. I have no other idea why they would be up this much since they technically missed on the quarter because those headline excluded numbers are actually numbers that hit the bottom line, and their numbers are down from 1 year ago. They cam in soft on both counts. Sector rotation? Not sure what else to make of this.

Topic.Title: Why is the market up today? We just got attacked in Boston...Over 120 Americans injured or dead

Message.Msg: That is the craziest #$%$ I have ever heard!!! It is connected...The United States has a terrorist attack and no suspects and you say it is not connected to the market!!!!!??? Will this cause another war? Increased security? Could this be a group of terrorist or one person... Domestic or abroad... the President says it was a Terrorist attack on our country and you relate that to a Big Mac? A less safe America affects the Market much more than Netflix subscriptions. Do you think the few stocks you buy or consumers buy are a big deal in the larger picture? No way, there is a way bigger financial world out there and it is lead by Interest rates, bonds, swaps and credt lines... all this is greatly affected by a terrorist attack. Trust me behind the scenes it is connected and a big deal. But consumers are always the last to know. Is this the normal now? Are 170 people injured or dead no big deal anymore? Are we used to this now? I worry it is like we are walking zombies. Is your money safe? Is our country safe? Are you safe? Two days ago 170 people involved in a maraton thought they were and look at what happened.

Topic.Title: Why is the market up today? We just got attacked in Boston...Over 120 Americans injured or dead

Message.Msg: What happened in Boston is certainly a big deal, but the market will shrug it off. To answer your question about whether I feel safe...I am in Spain, serving in the Navy, doing my best every day to make sure you're safe. Recommend you have a drink, relax a little, and realize that bad things happen every day, some days are certainly worse than others...but the machine keeps going...and I go to work every day to make sure the conditions are as optimal as possible for the machine to continue. Best of luck to you in your investments good Sir. Best thing you can do is cut back on Fox News and divisive talk radio, ratchet down the paranoia, and focus on the things you can control. This devastating event isn't one of them.

Message.Title: Ko is way overvalued. Should sell for 15-16x earnings not 22x its growth days are over
Message.Msg: They beat the pathetic numbers but they have very little growth....consumer stocks are in a bubble chasing yield..Ko is worth $35 at best

Topic.Title: miss on revenue and beat earnings = accounting fraud

Message.Msg: Its beyond the quarterly numbers. All of these factors seem to drive the stock price more than the earnings for one quarter. Plus two less selling dates than last year. Margins did increase. Worldwide case volume also was up vs last quarter. Earnings and sales beat analyst estimates for this quarter. The faster than expected granting of new expanded U.S. territories to five of its bottling companies did not hurt.

Topic.Title: miss on revenue and beat earnings = accounting fraud

Message.Msg: True, bottling was a factor. My only other guess is that there was a lot of pessimism for the sales of non-carbonated to outweigh drops in soda in the US and elsewhere where people are being more concerned about health effects of soda. Their numbers for tea and orange juice showed resiliency of the product line-up and willingness of customers to stick with Coke products while shifting product categories. Sigh of relief and optimism that Coke can actually survive in a declining soda consumption West.

Topic.Title: Buffett could get coke to get rid of flame retardant, if he wanted to.

Message.Msg: Not if you don't let them drink Coke. The beauty of choice in the open market. My kids have never had a Coke in their life. My 10 yo daughter hasn't had a soda in her life. I cracked open a Coke this afternoon in honor of today's run up. I had a Coke and a smile.

Topic.Title: miss on revenue and beat earnings = accounting fraud

Message.Msg: It's an S&P500 stock. Anal-ysts MUST low ball estimates for all S&P 500 stocks. Look at the dropped estimates for next quarter. They have always low-balled for at least 1 decade. That's always been the name of the game.
